original_definition: 'countertrading' means a cross zonal exchange initiated by system operators between two bidding zones to relieve physical congestion;
generated_definition: 'countertrading' means the simultaneous purchase and sale of the same financial instrument on different markets or at different times, in order to profit from differences in prices.
